runs.notes: Rest Day. Focus on hydration, nutrition, and sleep. Optional light mobility work or gentle yoga (15-20 mins).

Easy Run 10km at 6:30-7:00/km pace. Keep this truly easy to prepare for Friday's long run. Focus on relaxed form. Warm-up: 5 min easy walk, followed by dynamic stretches. Cool-down: 5 min very easy jog, followed by light stretches.

Easy Run 10km at 6:30-7:00/km pace. Keep this at a comfortable, conversational pace. Focus on good form and staying well-hydrated throughout. Run earlier or later in the day to avoid peak heat if possible. Warm-up: 5 min easy walking + light dynamic stretches. Cool-down: 5 min easy walking + light stretching.

Rest Day. Complete rest day to prepare for tomorrow's long run. Focus on hydration (aim for 2.5-3L of fluid), good nutrition with adequate carbohydrates, and quality sleep. Optional light stretching or foam rolling (15 mins).

Long Run 24km at 6:15-6:45/km pace. Even effort throughout. Take water every 20-30 mins, energy gels at 8km and 16km. Try to run earlier in the morning to avoid the worst heat. Focus on steady endurance rather than speed. Warm-up: 5-10 min easy jogging + dynamic stretches. Cool-down: 10 min walking + light stretching.

Quality Session: Total 8.8km as follows: 2km warm-up, 4 x 800m at threshold pace (5:45-6:00/km) with 400m recovery jogs, 2km cool-down. Focus on maintaining good form and consistent pace across all intervals. Warm-up: 10 min progressive jog + dynamic drills. Cool-down: 10 min easy jog + stretching.

Hilly Medium-Long Run 12km at 6:30-6:45/km on flats, effort-based on hills. Focus on strong uphill form and controlled downhill running. This run maintains your hill training element while keeping the distance moderate after yesterday's quality session. Warm-up: 5 min easy jogging + hip mobility exercises. Cool-down: 5 min easy jog + stretching.
